title: Fake News: Roseanne Did NOT Adopt 3 Year Old African Kid To Prove She's Not Racist | Lead Stories
subtitle: Did Roseanne Barr adopt a 3-year-old African boy named Eyob Tafawa to prove she is not racist? No, that's not...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Did Roseanne Barr adopt a 3-year-old African boy named Eyob Tafawa to prove she is not racist? No, that's not true (the part about the adoption). That claim was made by a site that publishes satirical fake news stories (which it calls "fauxtire"), it did not really happen.

The story originated from an article published by Huzlers on June 1, 2018 titled "Roseanne Adopts 3 Year Old African Kid To Prove She's Not Racist" (archived here) which opened:

Huzlers styles itself as a "fauxtire" website and carries a disclaimer at the bottom of each page:

According to Splinter News the site is run by Pablo Reyes and David Martinez and according to Buzzfeed Reyes is involved with several other fake news websites. They tend to shy away from political stories, opting instead to write for a more "urban" audience, with stories about rappers, criminals and celebrities.

We wrote about huzlers.com before, here are our most recent articles that mention the site:
• Real News: Man Arrested For Going To Parks And Telling Kids Where Children Come From
• Fake News: Man Did NOT Kill His Best Friend For Not Saying "No Homo" After 10-hour Anal Session
• Fake News: White Girl Who Said N-Word At Kendrick Lamar's Concert NOT Beat By Group Of Black Students At School
• Fake News: Babysitter On Crystal Meth Did NOT Eat 3-Month-Old Toddler AGAIN
• Fake News: Woman Did NOT Shoot Boyfriend For Catching Her Cheating Without Permission To Catch Her
